text.p: The following are the stories reported in Lithuanian newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
ALL THE NEWSPAPERS
- U.S. President Bill Clinton was met at the Inter-Continental hotel in Helsinki by a group of Lithuanian students urging for membership in NATO.
LIETUVOS RYTAS

- Nearly all the prosecutors from the organised crime investigation department, who helped disband the most powerful criminal gang in Vilnius, may resign to start a private bureau, newspaper sources say.
- Lithuania's agricultural exports to the European Union decreased last year by 10 percent to 394.4 million litas.
-The second biggest private financial institution in the country, Hermis bank, reported audited net profit of 27.4 million litas in 1996.
- Lithuania will subsidise the production of meat, 380-600 litas per tonne of beef and 200 litas per tonne of pork.
RESPUBLIKA
- The deputy head of the security department Kazys Pednychia accepted the offer of the minister of justice to take the post of prosecutor general.
- Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius said that budget revenues in March improved but were still below the target although he declined to mention figures.
- Major foreign investors said Lithuania was a good place to develop business and the majority of them would invest again, a Lithuania investment agency survey showed.
LIETUVOS AIDAS
- The chairman of parliament Vytautas Landsbergis leaves for a three-day visit to Germany today to launch his political autobiography.
- The government will pay major attention to implementation of economic programmes and the struggle against crime, Vagnorius told a news conference.
VERSLO ZINIOS

- Estonian Hoiupank has decided to move to Lithuania but if it does not come to an agreement to acquire the control share portfolio of one of the three Lithuanian banks, Agricultural, Ukio or Litimpex, before June, the bank will open its representative office, the newspaper said.
- Utenos beverages will start to bottle Pepsi Cola, Mirinda orange and Mirinda lemon on May 1 according to the agreement reached with Pepsi-Cola General Bottlers in February.
- Lietuvos Aidas daily newspaper intends to announce about a share capital boost to 2.8 million litas from 1.3 million litas.
- The national association of road cargo carriers Linava said carriers had 1.5 billion litas income in 1996.
-Andrius Vilkancas, Vilnius newsroom + 370 2 22 35 17
